text: I guess one of the things that really confuses me is that, I would think that ReverseDiff would call the function with the tracker types on the forward pass to record the operations (and allocate memory for the gradients) and then just do back prop. But if I do type asserts or print types in a step function using InterpolatingAdjoint, sometimes the type is a normal array and sometimes it's a TrackedArray. This doesn't make sense to me.

elements.text: I guess one of the things that really confuses me is that, I would think that ReverseDiff would call the function with the tracker types on the forward pass to record the operations (and allocate memory for the gradients) and then just do back prop. But if I do type asserts or print types in a step function using InterpolatingAdjoint, sometimes the type is a normal array and sometimes it's a TrackedArray. This doesn't make sense to me.
